# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is a simple way to implement this function in Julia. 

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"[\s|-]+" => "_")
end
```
This function firstly converts the column name to lower case using `lowercase` function, and then removes leading or trailing whitespaces with `strip`. Finally, it replaces spaces and hyphens with underscores by replacing all matching patterns with an underscore using regular expression.

For instance, calling `clean_column("My Column")` will return "my_column".
